intro: Gouinia gracilis, commonly known as the slender gouinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Gouinia gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
